intro: Vangueria soutpansbergensis, commonly known as the Soutpansberg vangueria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has elliptical leaves that are usually hairy and glandular. Vangueria soutpansbergensis is adapted to arid conditions and is often used in traditional medicine.
